channel.title: math.AT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.AT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: A comparison of definitions of equivariant trees
item.description: arXiv:2512.14956v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We show that various categories of trees can be modeled by Grothendieck constructions on categories of trees with a fixed set of leaves. We prove this result for the dendroidal category $\Omega$, the category $\Omega^G$ of trees with a $G$-action for a finite group $G$, and finally for the category of genuine equivariant trees $\Omega_G$ that has played an important role in recent work on genuine equivariant operads.
item.dc:creator: Julia E. Bergner, Maxine E. Calle, David Chan, Ang\'elica M. Osorno, Maru Sarazola

item.title: The Homotopy Type of Spaces of Flat Connections for Classical Lie Groups
item.description: arXiv:2512.15004v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Let $M$ be a smooth manifold. We use Chern-Weil theory to study the characteristic classes of principal $G$-bundles built from continuous families of $\pi_{1}(M)$-representations, where $G$ is a compact Lie group. We then relate these families to the functorial map $$\text{Hom}(\pi_{1}(M), G)\rightarrow\text{Map}_{*}(M,BG)$$ and use this relationship to study the weak homotopy type of the space of flat connections for $U(n)$, $O(n)$, $SO(n)$, and $\text{Spin}(n)$ bundles.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Davis

item.title: Filtrations and cohomology III: cohomology of $E_\infty$ rings
item.description: arXiv:2512.15509v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We discuss filtrations arising from de Rham-type cohomology theories for $E_\infty$ rings and $E_n$ rings. Examples include the HKR filtration on relative topological Hochschild homology, the Hodge filtration on $E_\infty$ infinitesimal cohomology, and the Hodge filtration on $E_\infty$ de Rham cohomology.
item.dc:creator: Benjamin Antieau

item.title: Multiplicative Equivariant Thom Spectra & Structured Real Orientations
item.description: arXiv:2512.15573v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: For strongly even $\mathbb{E}_{\infty}^{C_2}$-rings $E$ we show that any homotopy ring map $\mathrm{MU} \to E^e$ lifts to an $\mathbb{E}_{\rho}$-map $\mathrm{MU}_{\mathbb{R}} \to E$. This refines the Hahn--Shi Real orientations of Lubin--Tate theories $E_n$, the Hirzebruch level-$n$ orientations of $\mathrm{tmf}_1(n)$, and Quillen's idempotent to $\mathbb{E}_\rho$-maps. This allows us to provide the first structured version of $\mathrm{BP}_{\mathbb{R}}$ -- we show that it admits an $\mathbb{E}_{\rho}$-algebra structure. Furthermore, we extend these results to larger groups. In particular, for a finite group $C_2 \leq G$ the Hahn--Shi orientation $N_{C_2}^G \mathrm{MU}_{\mathbb{R}} \to E_n$ refines to a $\operatorname{Coind}_{C_2}^G \mathbb{E}_{\rho}$-map, and $N^G_{C_2}\mathrm{BP}_{\mathbb{R}}$ admits a $\operatorname{Coind}_{C_2}^G \mathbb{E}_{\rho}$-algebra structure. Essential to this program is a robust theory of multiplicative equivariant Thom spectra, which we develop using parametrized higher algebra and fibrous patterns -- particularly we provide an equivariant version of Antol\'in-Camarena--Barthel's universal property for multiplicative Thom spectra and use this to deduce a multiplicative equivariant Thom isomorphism. We provide a number of categorical results of independent interest, most notably a distributive monoidal structure on parametrized left module categories.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Quinn, Qi Zhu

item.title: Transfers on $\mathbb A^1$-connected components of quasi-split groups and the norm principle
item.description: arXiv:2512.15324v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We show that the sheaf of $\mathbb A^1$-connected components of a quasi-split group over a perfect field is a strictly $\mathbb A^1$-invariant sheaf with (Voevodsky) transfers. As a consequence, we show that the norm principle holds for any quasi-split group over a perfect field.
item.dc:creator: Amit Hogadi, Anand Sawant

item.title: Classifying Infinity Topoi via Weighted Limits
item.description: arXiv:2512.15613v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We construct classifying $\infty$-topoi by showing that the $(\infty,2)$-category of topoi has weighted limits. We show that several prestacks of interest have a classifying topos, including the prestack of spectra.
item.dc:creator: Ivan Di Liberti, Nicholas Meadows

item.title: \v{C}ech cohomology of infinite projective spaces, flag manifolds, and related spaces
item.description: arXiv:2506.16487v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We compute the \v{C}ech cohomology ring of a countable product of infinite projective spaces, and that of an infinite flag manifold. The method of our first result in fact computes the cohomology ring of a countably infinite product of paracompact Hausdorff spaces, under some mild assumptions.
item.dc:creator: David Anderson, Matthias Franz

item.title: Revisiting $(\infty,2)$-naturality of the Yoneda embedding
item.description: arXiv:2508.11526v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We show that the Yoneda embedding 'is' $(\infty,2)$-natural with respect to the functoriality of presheaves via left Kan extension, refining the $(\infty,1)$-categorical result proven independently by Haugseng-Hebestreit-Linskens-Nuiten and Ramzi, and answering a question of Ben-Moshe. As the key technical ingredient, we show that the identity functor of the $(\infty,1)$-category of $(\infty,1)$-categories admits only one enhancement to an $(\infty,2)$-functor (namely, the identity functor).
item.dc:creator: Tobias Lenz
